snippet: Leobardo Espinoza Jr., a first-generation, low-income college applicant in Kansas, says it is "unfair to assume that students like me have an easier path to college" because "it devalues the work we do."
abstract: Leobardo Espinoza Jr., a first-generation, low-income college applicant in Kansas, says it is "unfair to assume that students like me have an easier path to college" because "it devalues the work we do."

headline.main: A College Applicant With an 'Advantage' Manages Expectations
